comment.author: 33700143@N05
comment._content: The decision to tilt these folks within the vignette... now, where's that come from? Wonderful stuff.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: Maybe it was the best photo of the shoot? Always check the wedding photographer's references first ...

comment.author: 25460490@N08
comment._content: I don't think that's a vignette - just a black background to show the shape of the button. You can see the light reflecting off the curved edges. But as you say, they would still be at a slight angle within the button, which is unusual!

comment.author: 25334189@N07
comment._content: All the buttons were photographed on black velvet.

comment.author: 78821503@N00
comment._content: I believe the decision to tilt the photo for the button was done to keep the couple on the same level. Lines connecting the tops and bottoms of the heads are roughly parallel as well as the noses being centered.Your eyes flow smoothly from one to the other.The greater the height difference the more severe the tilt would be.
